p:
Climatic fluctuations have been implicated as triggers for influenza epidemics in temperate regions. A study of state-level epidemiological data from the United States found that influenza epidemics sometimes follow 2-week periods of anomalously low absolute humidity
10 . Subsequent studies of epidemiological activity have found similar results using prefecture-level data from Japan
11 , city-level data from the New York Metropolitan Area
12 and region-level data from France
13 .
